description: In this series, Vonne and Justin explore the intricate world of Object-Oriented Programming(OOP), particularly in the context of the Python programming language. Starting with the basics of OOP, Justin demonstrates the creation of classes and associated objects from those classes. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of Inheritance of classes to reduce code repetitiveness in an effort to adhere to the Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY) principle. Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!

Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!
name: Object Oriented Python
subtitle: Coding the way the cool kids do

episodes.description: In this series, Vonne and Justin explore the intricate world of Object-Oriented Programming(OOP), particularly in the context of the Python programming language. Starting with the basics of OOP, Justin demonstrates the creation of classes and associated objects from those classes. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of Inheritance of classes to reduce code repetitiveness in an effort to adhere to the Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY) principle. Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.433
[SOUND] In this series, we're going to
be covering object-oriented Python.

2
00:00:07.433 --> 00:00:10.091
So Justin, what exactly is
object-oriented Python, and

3
00:00:10.091 --> 00:00:12.060
what are are we gonna be covering?

4
00:00:12.060 --> 00:00:12.576
>> So Yvonne,

5
00:00:12.576 --> 00:00:16.206
object-oriented Python is a particular
take on object-oriented programming.

6
00:00:16.206 --> 00:00:20.074
So we're gonna start by looking at
object-oriented programming from a very

7
00:00:20.074 --> 00:00:23.645
high level, like abstraction,
encapsulation, polymorphism, and

8
00:00:23.645 --> 00:00:24.730
inheritance.

9
00:00:24.730 --> 00:00:27.240
But then we're gonna take
a look at how those ideas

10
00:00:27.240 --> 00:00:29.560
play into the Python language themselves.

11
00:00:29.560 --> 00:00:33.060
And particularly, look at classes,
multiple inheritance,

12
00:00:33.060 --> 00:00:38.040
single inheritance, how to use those
classes, and then what that all entails.

13
00:00:38.040 --> 00:00:40.670
>> Okay, so that's a good big
picture that we're going with.

14
00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:41.650
What about the specifics?

15
00:00:41.650 --> 00:00:43.310
What are we really gonna be diving into?

16
00:00:43.310 --> 00:00:47.350
>> So as far as specifics for Python,
after we cover the object-oriented

17
00:00:47.350 --> 00:00:49.880
programming principles,
we're gonna take a look at Python.

18
00:00:49.880 --> 00:00:51.860
How do I create a class, right?

19
00:00:51.860 --> 00:00:52.810
How do I start?

20
00:00:52.810 --> 00:00:53.690
What are methods?

21
00:00:53.690 --> 00:00:55.780
How do I add methods to classes?

22
00:00:55.780 --> 00:00:59.470
In particular, we're gonna pay
close attention on being Pythonic.

23
00:00:59.470 --> 00:01:03.420
So if we give our class to someone else
that writes Python, they'll go, yeah,

24
00:01:03.420 --> 00:01:06.360
this is Python code,
and it looks Pythonic.

25
00:01:06.360 --> 00:01:10.394
And then we're gonna illustrate the
nuanced differences between the difference

26
00:01:10.394 --> 00:01:12.391
inheritance models of Python, right?

27
00:01:12.391 --> 00:01:14.043
What about single inheritance,

28
00:01:14.043 --> 00:01:17.660
which is available in a great deal
of object-oriented languages?

29
00:01:17.660 --> 00:01:20.143
But also,
Python provides multiple inheritance.

30
00:01:20.143 --> 00:01:25.112
And as kind of a juxtaposition to that,
how can we not use multiple inheritance,

31
00:01:25.112 --> 00:01:29.200
cuz it does have its issues,
and use composition instead?

32
00:01:29.200 --> 00:01:32.620
And in the grand finale,
we're gonna start building

33
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:36.960
a text-based adventure game employing
these object-oriented principles.

34
00:01:36.960 --> 00:01:41.730
And building these Python classes to,
well, play a game and

35
00:01:41.730 --> 00:01:43.800
see how that kind of burgeons forth.

36
00:01:43.800 --> 00:01:47.370
>> All right, so what should we
know before starting this series?

37
00:01:47.370 --> 00:01:51.490
What do you assume people out there
should know before watching anything?

38
00:01:51.490 --> 00:01:53.460
And what's our ultimate goal?

39
00:01:53.460 --> 00:01:57.630
>> So Yvonne, as far as who's this course,
this series concerned, right?

40
00:01:57.630 --> 00:01:59.790
Who's actually going to benefit most?

41
00:01:59.790 --> 00:02:01.500
If you've been programming
in Python before,

42
00:02:01.500 --> 00:02:03.380
you know a little bit about the language.

43
00:02:03.380 --> 00:02:05.800
You know how a for loop and
a while loop works.

44
00:02:05.800 --> 00:02:11.270
You know how to construct integers and
floats and various object strings.

45
00:02:11.270 --> 00:02:14.490
This is probably gonna be a good
way to level up your skills.

46
00:02:14.490 --> 00:02:19.830
However, if you've never programmed in
Python before, or maybe you've touched on

47
00:02:19.830 --> 00:02:24.320
it, you've seen it, this may be a little
beyond what you're comfortable with.

48
00:02:24.320 --> 00:02:27.170
With that said,
it never hurts to check things out.

49
00:02:27.170 --> 00:02:31.500
So the ultimate goal is to
level up your Python skills.

50
00:02:31.500 --> 00:02:33.810
But unfortunately,
there is not a certification at the end,

51
00:02:33.810 --> 00:02:37.860
as some of our other
technology avenues take us.

52
00:02:37.860 --> 00:02:39.500
It's just about getting better.

53
00:02:39.500 --> 00:02:43.403
So if that sounds like something you're
interested in, definitely check this out,

54
00:02:43.403 --> 00:02:44.607
and we'll see you there.

55
00:02:46.171 --> 00:02:48.610
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin cover the basics of getting started in Object-Oriented Python. They cover topics such as the current version of Python, types of text editors and IDEs to edit code, and testing in the REPL.
episodes.title: Installation and Setup

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin review the basic principles of Object-Oriented Programming: encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, and polymorphism.  These principles will be demonstrated and referred to throughout the series.
episodes.title: What is Object Oriented Programming

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin discuss creating classes and objects. In addition, they cover adding methods to those objects as well as things to consider when using these features in Object-Oriented Python.
episodes.title: Creating Classes and Objects in Python

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin discuss extending classes and demonstrate both single and multiple inheritance.
episodes.title: Extending Classes

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin continue extending classes and multiple inheritance.  They also cover the topic of composition - demonstrating why this principle is favored as best practice.
episodes.title: Extending Classes Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin build a simple text based game called MonsterSlash using Object-Oriented Python. They cover the game design and establish the actors in the game â€“ the player and the enemy.
episodes.title: Lets Build It MonsterSlash v.1

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin jump back in to building their MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover how the player can engage the enemy and win!
episodes.title: Lets Build It MonsterSlash v.1 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin refine the game code in the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover making the code cleaner and more efficient as well as extending some of the aspects of the game.
episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.1 Game Refactor

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin refine the actor code in the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover making the code cleaner and more efficient as well as extending some of the aspects of the player and the enemy.
episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.1 Actor Refactor

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin are back with version 2 of the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python by expanding the characteristics of the actors and the game.
episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.2 Enemies Attack

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin finish up with some final touches of version 2 of the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python.
episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.2 Enemies Attack Part 2
